p: To suppress the production and focal accumulation of ROS in P. oryzae-infected rice cells, Cyt A (Cayman Chemical Company, Ann Arbor, MI, USA) and DPI (Sigma-Aldrich, St. Louis, MO, USA) treatments were performed as described previously with slight modification [ 20]. Briefly, 41.8 µM of Cyt A or different concentrations (1, 3, 5 µM) of DPI were mixed with the freshly harvested spore suspension (5.0 × 10 5 mL −1) of P. oryzae INA168. The Cyt A- or DPI-treated spores were inoculated into rice leaf sheaths ( n = 4) along with untreated spores (Mock). The effects of Cyt A and DPI were observed at 48 hpi using fluorescence microscopy (Zeiss equipped with Axioplan 2; Campbell, CA, USA).
